title: Body Camera Footage Request for Arrest on April 30, 2025

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Body Camera Footage Request for Arrest on April 30, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All available body-worn camera footage related to the arrest of Joseph Arthur Bowles-Morrison on April 30, 2025, by the Chattanooga Police Department.

This request is limited to body camera footage only.

If any portion is withheld, please provide a written explanation citing the specific legal exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Robert Cass.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Wage Theft Division
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am seeking all data collected by your department for wage theft investigations, including those done by the Wage Theft Task Force
Data includes: 
- Dates of investigations, case open and close dates
- Companies and employers cited and investigated by the department
 - Wages and other monetary damages collected
- Reason for investigation
- Number of complaints filed
- Number of court orders issued by the department
- Data is related to 853 Wage Theft – Criminal charge

If data is collected in a single or multiple databases, please release it in .xlsx/.csv format. Otherwise .pdf for other documents.
Please search from 2020 to today's date

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Email Metadata (CM Moore)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by CM Moore's office between the dates of April 7, 2025 and April 18, 2025: Sender, Recipient (To, CC, BCC), Date and time sent, Subject. As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Legislative Branch :: C224638-050525
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on May 05, 2025 and is appended below. Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your email contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center emails to your Inbox. 
 
The reference number for this request is C224638-050525. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 186193-54632443@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password 
You may now visit the PRRC 'My Records Request Center' anytime! 
 
Request C224638-050525:  
" To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by CM Moore's office between the dates of April 7, 2025 and April 18, 2025: Sender, Recipient (To, CC, BCC), Date and time sent, Subject. As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcity-council-219%252Femail-metadata-cm-moore-186193%252F%253Femail%253Dmuckrockseattle%252540mycusthelp.net&url_auth_token=AAAbJZGmT3P2zP3bJRwaBEZW1ME%3A1uC7zy%3AbzztLUt3YKgNYeNSV97xRD2BQAwaZYKQHGsx7EZB5nE"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IHSC Hunger Strike Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the IHSC Hunger Strike Data document by facility type for each month between July 2024, and May 2025. An example of the record I seek is available here: https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/24852977-ihsc-hungerstrikesbymonth/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Your verification code
communications.communication: Your confirmation code is 698432

title: IHSC Sentinel Event / Near Miss Records

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

An IHSC record reflecting the number, by month & year, facility, event type, and resolution of all Near Miss or Sentinel Events in ICE detention facilities for the period beginning January 1, 2021, and continuing through to the present. 

I seek expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and declare under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 U.S.C. 1746 that the following statements are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and understanding:
1. I am a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination, and I have been granted expedited processing on this basis previously by federal FOIA agencies. Examples of my edited works are available here: https://theappeal.org/authors/andrew-free/, here: https://atlpresscollective.com/author/free/, and here: https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2024/06/2024-07-01-ICE-Detainee-Deaths.pdf.
2. As ICE has rapidly increased its detained noncitizen population since January 2025, mortality in ICE custody has also rapidly increased.
3. ICE is presently on track to allow more people to die in the agency's custody than in any year since FY2020, when the COVID19 pandemic ripped through facilities claiming lives until federal judges ordered targeted depopulation over ICE's objections.

Table 1: Publicly Reported Deaths in ICE Custody by Fiscal Year since PBNDS 2011 adoption.
FY COUNT of FY
11 10
12 8
13 9
14 6
15 7
16 10
17 12
18 10
19 9
20 22
21 5
22 3
23 4
24 12
25 10

4. Public reports indicate Congress intends to appropriate a roughly 900% increase in ICE detention funding, spending $45 billion to expand the deadly detention system. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/07/us/politics/trump-administration-immigrant-detention-facilities-services.html.
5. Timely access to information regarding healthcare outcomes in ICE custody is essential to public health researchers, medical experts, policymakers, and informed citizens who wish to have a meaningful role in the policy debate over whether the proposed budget increase represents a lawful and prudent expenditure of public resources.
6. My previous FOIA work on ICE detention morbidity and mortality has resulted in obtaining records that have been shared with and cited by physicians, oversight agencies, Congress, and courts, influencing decisions that led to healthier outcomes for ICE's detained populations, and reducing the morbidity and mortality in ICE custody.
7. There is an urgent need to inform the public regarding IHSC's capacity to manage and oversee medical emergencies and conditions that could lead to deaths of people in ICE custody.

I respectfully request a fee waiver, as I will be publishing and circulating the results of the records I receive, and am not making this request for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your timely consideration of this time-sensitive request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all Significant Event Notifications and Significant Incident Reports involving Detainee Health where the box checked by the sender was "Deaths in Custody or Operations", Significant Injury or Illness, Hospital Admission, Emergency Department Visit, or Serious Health Incident Affecting Bedspace Volume for the period beginning April 1, 2024, and continuing through to the present. 

I seek expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and declare under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 U.S.C. 1746 that the following statements are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and understanding:
1. I am a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination, and I have been granted expedited processing on this basis previously by federal FOIA agencies. Table 1: Publicly Reported Deaths in ICE Custody by Fiscal Year since PBNDS 2011 adoption.
FY COUNT of FY
11 10
12 8
13 9
14 6
15 7
16 10
17 12
18 10
19 9
20 22
21 5
22 3
23 4
24 12
25 10

4. Public reports indicate Congress intends to appropriate a roughly 900% increase in ICE detention funding, spending $45 billion to expand the deadly detention system. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/07/us/politics/trump-administration-immigrant-detention-facilities-services.html.
5. Timely access to information regarding healthcare outcomes in ICE custody is essential to public health researchers, medical experts, policymakers, and informed citizens who wish to have a meaningful role in the policy debate over whether the proposed budget increase represents a lawful and prudent expenditure of public resources.
6. My previous FOIA work on ICE detention morbidity and mortality has resulted in obtaining records that have been shared with and cited by physicians, oversight agencies, Congress, and courts, influencing decisions that led to healthier outcomes for ICE's detained populations, and reducing the morbidity and mortality in ICE custody.
7. There is an urgent need to inform the public regarding IHSC's capacity to manage and oversee medical emergencies and conditions that could lead to deaths of people in ICE custody.

I respectfully request a fee waiver, as I will be publishing and circulating the results of the records I receive, and am not making this request for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your timely consideration of this time-sensitive request.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

Andrew Free

title: IHSC MQMU Monthly Meeting Minutes / Dashboards

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

ICE Health Services Corps (IHSC) monthly meeting minutes / notes / or dashboards reflecting cases of immigrants in ICE custody the IHSC Medical Quality Management Unit was monitoring, by facility, condition, and outcome, for each month beginning January 1, 2021, and continuing to the present. 

I seek expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and declare under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 U.S.C. 1746 that the following statements are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and understanding:
1. I am a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination, and I have been granted expedited processing on this basis previously by federal FOIA agencies. Examples of my edited works are available here: https://theappeal.org/authors/andrew-free/, here: https://atlpresscollective.com/author/free/, and here: https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2024/06/2024-07-01-ICE-Detainee-Deaths.pdf.

Table 1: Publicly Reported Deaths in ICE Custody by Fiscal Year since PBNDS 2011 adoption.

11 10
12 8
13 9
14 6
15 7
16 10
17 12

24 12
25 10

5. Timely access to information regarding healthcare outcomes in ICE custody is essential to public health researchers, medical experts, policymakers, and informed citizens who wish to have a meaningful role in the policy debate over whether the proposed budget increase represents a lawful and prudent expenditure of public resources.
6. My previous FOIA work on ICE detention morbidity and mortality has resulted in obtaining records that have been shared with and cited by physicians, oversight agencies, Congress, and courts, influencing decisions that led to healthier outcomes for ICE's detained populations, and reducing the morbidity and mortality in ICE custody.
7. There is an urgent need to inform the public regarding IHSC's capacity to manage and oversee medical emergencies and conditions that could lead to deaths of people in ICE custody.

I respectfully request a fee waiver, as I will be publishing and circulating the results of the records I receive, and am not making this request for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your timely consideration of this time-sensitive request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Andrew Free

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

An IHSC record showing the number, by month and year if possible, of Significant Event Notifications (SENs), Significant Incident Reports (SIRs), or similar records IHSC received for the period beginning January 1, 2021, and continuing through May 5, 2025, in which ICE ERO Field Office staff, ICE detention contractors, or IHSC Field Medical Coordinators who submitted the SEN or SIR checked the box next to "Death in Custody or Operations", "Hospital Admission," "Emergency Department Visit (ED", or "Serious Health Incidents Affected Bedspace Volume".

Here is an example of SEN/SIR data from a single ICE detention facility provided in response to a prior FOIA: https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25469567-aurora-medical-sens-sirs-2023-icfo-03979-001/. I am seeking a report from the IHSC system of records the government's detention medical supervisors use to track and monitor these SENs and SIRs at facilities nationwide. I am willing to discuss narrowing or altering this requests should IHSC have a more efficient means of providing something similar to allow for data analysis. 

I seek expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and declare under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 U.S.C. 1746 that the following statements are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and understanding: 
1. I am a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination, and I have been granted expedited processing on this basis previously by federal FOIA agencies.  Examples of my edited works are available here: https://theappeal.org/authors/andrew-free/, here: https://atlpresscollective.com/author/free/, and here: https://assets.aclu.org/live/uploads/2024/06/2024-07-01-ICE-Detainee-Deaths.pdf. 
2. As ICE has rapidly increased its detained noncitizen population since January 2025, mortality in ICE custody has also rapidly increased. 
3. ICE is presently on track to allow more people to die in the agency's custody than in any year since FY2020, when the COVID19 pandemic ripped through facilities claiming lives until federal judges ordered targeted depopulation over ICE's objections. 

Table 1: Publicly Reported Deaths in ICE Custody by Fiscal Year since PBNDS 2011 adoption.
FY	COUNT of FY
11	10
12	8
13	9
14	6
15	7
16	10
17	12
18	10
19	9
20	22
21	5
22	3
23	4
24	12
25	10

4. Public reports indicate Congress intends to appropriate a roughly 900% increase in ICE detention funding, spending $45 billion to expand the deadly detention system. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/07/us/politics/trump-administration-immigrant-detention-facilities-services.html. 
5. Timely access to information regarding healthcare outcomes in ICE custody is essential to public health researchers, medical experts, policymakers, and informed citizens who wish to have a meaningful role in the policy debate over whether the proposed budget increase represents a lawful and prudent expenditure of public resources. 
6. My previous FOIA work on ICE detention morbidity and mortality has resulted in obtaining records that have been shared with and cited by physicians, oversight agencies, Congress, and courts, influencing decisions that led to healthier outcomes for ICE's detained populations, and reducing the morbidity and mortality in ICE custody. 
7. There is an urgent need to inform the public regarding IHSC's capacity to manage and oversee medical emergencies and conditions that could lead to deaths of people in ICE custody. 

I respectfully request a fee waiver, as I will be publishing and circulating the results of the records I receive, and am not making this request for commercial purposes. 

Thank you in advance for your timely consideration of this time-sensitive request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: CO County CVR Request (Larimer County Clerk and Recorder)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (Larimer County Clerk and Recorder)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the voting system.

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the voting system. 

In case it is helpful for your reference, you can find an example of these records in REDACTED format at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.)

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

Jomary Tavarez

communications.subject: Evidence.com - Evidence Download Link
communications.communication:
Axon - Marion County Sheriff's Dept. - FL   
    
   
     
 Axon - Marion County Sheriff's Dept. - FL  
    
 
  
Evidence.com - Evidence Download Link 
 
  
 IRISHAMIR MOOREHEAD (Badge ID: 5210) from Marion County Sheriff's Dept. - FL (https://marionsherifffl.evidence.com) has sent you a link to download evidence on Evidence.com. After clicking on the link below you will download 1 zip or iso files containing the requested evidence. This download may take a while depending on your internet connection. 

ref case 23017196 
Please note that your access to this link will expire on June 4, 2025 13:11:23 (-04:00). 
Afterwards, you will need to contact the sender to request access. 

Download link: 
[Click here to download] (https://marionsherifffl.evidence.com/axon/download/edf4041223c34940ad4b5d04b2fc502a/90eab4686392412cbfcfac419c86f573?token=sdXm3WVfj3S6XFXz7xXFdLnGOgJHYfds%2Bd%2FcNXwVNFysFaCqA9uHI9RhFEVQ9ASzVtlsOFhPNYStvZ54G4HTlGRI%2Bpz4PzQfMyCLzoAYp8kd0WokujEbGhGtDmGsBgYmSOTrD1iHL6GljoCbHzAKeU3yPrzXHE4tlMeL0BCY%2FYG2uwWesZl%2F1xNTf%2F8rrtFG5zkd6iHh69o39W1ylEEwECpLnC3q%2BJYKu%2BA6qFa2f5A%3D&version=1) 
 
 
 Thank you, 
The Axon Team 
 
 SECURITY NOTICE: Axon will not send you emails that request your username, password, security questions, or any other sensitive information. If you receive an email requesting information, it is most likely an attempt to gain access to your account. Furthermore, please verify that any hyperlinks in the message above begin with the proper URL e.g. "https://agencyname.evidence.com". Please forward emails that appear suspicious to help@evidence.com.

communications.subject: Public Record Request Submitted for Public Record Request - George Smith
communications.communication:
Hello George Smith,

Public Record Request Title


Public Record Request - George Smith  


Public Record Request #


NPR2025-0077362 


Name of Requestor


George Smith 


Status


Submitted 


Request Submitted Date


5/6/2025 5:00 PM 






Your Public Record Service Request has been successfully submitted. You will be notified by email if more information or payment is required and when your request is completed. The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department - Public Records Unit hours of operation are 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday, excluding holidays, Juneteenth, Nevada Day, the day after Thanksgiving and December 24th.  Any public record requests made outside of normal business hours will be deemed received the next business day. At any time, you may monitor the status of your request by logging into your Public Records portal account.

***Please note that holidays that fall on a Saturday or Sunday will be observed the preceding Friday or the following Monday. There are 13 holidays that LVMPD observes throughout the year. Based on this information, adjust your request accordingly.

Public Request Portal | Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department (lvmpd.com)<https://www.lvmpd.com/i-want-to/file/public-request-portal>

Thank you,

Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department
400 S. Martin L. King Boulevard
Las Vegas, Nevada  89106
702-828-7489
Monday-Friday 8am to 5pm
